overview: From 2026-02-09 to 2026-02-10, elizaos/eliza had 0 new PRs (0 merged), 3 new issues, and 4 active contributors.

topIssues.title: [Bug] URL in message triggers duplicate LLM calls - processed as both text and attachment (webapp)
topIssues.author: thewoweffect
topIssues.body:
## Description
When a user sends a message containing a URL, ElizaOS processes it twice:
1. As text content → generates response
2. As attachment (metadata/preview) → generates second response

Both responses are sent through the same SSE stream before the `done` event, resulting in duplicated text in the final response.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Start ElizaOS with webapp
2. Send a message containing a URL (e.g., "Check this: https://example.com")
3. Observe the response

## Expected Behavior
URL should be processed once, generating a single response.

## Actual Behavior
Two identical (or near-identical) responses are generated and streamed as one message, doubling token usage and producing duplicated output.

## Impact
- 2x LLM API calls per message with URL
- Doubled token costs
- Poor UX with duplicated responses
- Forces workarounds on client side

## Environment
- ElizaOS version: [your version]
- Client: webapp

## Suggested Fix
Ensure URL is processed either as text OR as attachment, not both. The decision should happen in the message processing flow before LLM calls.

topIssues.title: [Infra] Memory Persistence System
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Make sure Eliza remembers conversations and user preferences across sessions.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Conversation history stored in Neon DB
- [ ] Memory recall working across messaging platforms
- [ ] User can ask "what did we talk about yesterday?"
- [ ] Memory search via vector DB/Redis

## Technical Notes

* "Eliza remembers everything" is a key feature from product spec
* Memory anchored on-chain (Jeju) for unruggable persistence
* Redis or vector database for memory search optimization

## Priority

**P1 - Day 4**

topIssues.title: [Infra] Implement User Session Isolation
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Make sure each user interaction creates/resumes their own Eliza agent instance with isolated state. Critical for multi-tenant serverless architecture.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] User identified from messaging platform (phone number, Telegram ID, Discord ID)
- [ ] New users get a fresh Eliza clone
- [ ] Returning users resume their existing session
- [ ] Memory and conversation history persisted per user
- [ ] No data leakage between users

## Technical Notes

* Leverage existing serverless multi-tenant infrastructure
* Each user = separate container/session
* Reference existing Cloud app cloning mechanism
* "Cannot build agent company not serverless - you will go bankrupt"
* No empty containers running when not in use

## Priority

**P0 - Day 3**

topIssues.title: [Plugin] Integrate Calendar Plugin
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Enable Eliza to manage Google Calendar for scheduling and meeting management.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] OAuth flow for Calendar authentication
- [ ] View upcoming events
- [ ] Create new calendar events
- [ ] Meeting prep summaries
- [ ] Scheduling assistance

## Technical Notes

* Key Claudebot feature - must have parity
* OAuth link sent via message when user requests Calendar
* This is a productivity capability from the Eliza App spec

## Priority

**P1 - Day 4**

topIssues.title: [Plugin] Configure Dynamic Plugin Loading
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Implement system where plugins are loaded dynamically based on user needs/requests (regex or intent matching).

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Plugin registry with available capabilities
- [ ] Intent detection to determine which plugin to invoke
- [ ] Lazy loading of plugins to optimize resources
- [ ] Clear user feedback when a plugin capability is not available
- [ ] OAuth flow triggers when user requests authenticated service

## Technical Notes

* Plugins loaded for each user in dynamic manner based on need
* Use regex or intent matching to determine plugin activation
* Reference Sayo's suggestion from meeting about dynamic loading

## Priority

**P0 - Day 3**
